channel.title: DVD Rip/Encoding Software
channel.description:
Before you offer me your favs, read this through please.
I'm using DVDShrink to rip a dvd to a single .vob file. Reasonable enough. Then I need to convert that to something AVISynth can read, possibly a low compression .avi file. Any good encoding software for this? Or is there something that can do it in one step? I need it in the .avi file so I can encode it to x264, the holy grail of video encoders. I'll play around with it some more, but if you guys have any tips, they are welcome.
Ok, this is what I'm doing atm.
1. DVDShrink to rip the main film from the dvd (stripping all the extras) to a single .vob file. Tested. 2. DVD2AVI to convert the .vob file to .avi file. In Progress. 3. Something to split the .avi file to a .avi video-only file and a .wav audio file. 4. MeGUI to convert the .avi to a .264 file, then the .wav to a .m4a file. 5. MeGUI muxer to interweave the .264 file and the .m4a file to a single .mp4 file.

item.title: DVD Rip/Encoding Software
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Before you offer me your favs, read this through please.

I’m using DVDShrink to rip a dvd to a single .vob file. Reasonable enough. Then I need to convert that to something AVISynth can read, possibly a low compression .avi file. Any good encoding software for this? Or is there something that can do it in one step? I need it in the .avi file so I can encode it to x264, the holy grail of video encoders. I’ll play around with it some more, but if you guys have any tips, they are welcome.

Ok, this is what I’m doing atm.

  1. DVDShrink to rip the main film from the dvd (stripping all the extras) to a single .vob file. Tested.
  2. DVD2AVI to convert the .vob file to .avi file. In Progress.
  3. Something to split the .avi file to a .avi video-only file and a .wav audio file.
  4. MeGUI to convert the .avi to a .264 file, then the .wav to a .m4a file.
  5. MeGUI muxer to interweave the .264 file and the .m4a file to a single .mp4 file.

Read full topic
